data.name: PD_DataFieldFormats_t
data.value:
Specify the content for this template. You can use placeholders in [square brackets] for referencing other data field values. Use [1], [2], [3] .. [n] to reference data values passed to this template.

Note: in caching-enabled Data Sources using this Data Field Template, changes made to this setting will not be reflected immediately but delayed as configured on the Data Source's Caching tab.

data.name: PD_DataFieldFormats_m
data.value:
Keep this set to Plain if you are only providing textual content with or without placeholders. Set this to HTML if you need to provide additional imagery, custom formattings, hyperlinks etc. Both modes support [placeholders in square brackets].

Note: in caching-enabled Data Sources using this Data Field Template, changes made to this setting will not be reflected immediately but delayed as configured on the Data Source's Caching tab.

Tick this check box to always add an [All] quick-filter tab that shows all data records unfiltered (and to always make this the initially-selected tab, too).

data.name: ConfigHelp_ItemConfigChoice
data.value: The drop-down menu provides a set of choices that can be customized on the Configuration page of the {PROD} Studio.

data.name: FilterLive
data.value: For interactive FilterZen filters, use Ajax-based live filtering (instead of page-reloading post-backs; recommended unless your FilterZen Web Part also contains non-interactive (hidden background) filters or is also connected to other non-{PROD} Web Parts)

data.name: NoSite
data.value: This web application does not contain any site collections. Type a URL such as http://site/collection/url/_layouts/{0}/default.aspx (but replace 'http://site/collection/url/' with any full, valid SharePoint web site URL) to open the {1} Studio.

data.name: ConfigHelp_ItemIntro
data.value: The following settings can be customized for each {2} by administrative users on the {1} page in your {0} Studio, accessible via Site Settings / {0} Studio / {1}:

data.name: WelcomeMessage
data.value: We hope you will get the most out of this software product — if you miss anything in it to fully meet your requirements, or if you have trouble getting it to do what you need, please let us know in the {0} discussion forum or by writing us directly. We're happy to help!

data.name: LicSiteHtml
data.value: IS THIS the Site Collection to be licensed? If not, select it from the drop-down lists at the top.

data.name: FarmAdminError
data.value:
Even though you are technically a farm administrator, SQL Server refused to update the SharePoint Configuration Database:
{0}
If this sounds like a user permissions issue, review the current IIS application pool identity's Windows group or database role memberships and its appropriate security properties in the aforementioned SQL Server database.
Note that even though your changes have not been persisted, they may remain in memory for this Web Application on this farm server up until the next IIS reset.

A simpler work-around that usually works well is to retry your modifications after first selecting the Central Administration Web Application at the top (or any other one run from a high-privileged IIS application pool).

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_UnknownPropFormat
data.value: The HTML to be generated by the {PROD} Web Part (in Tiles view) for each data field that has no value. Valid placeholders: {0} for the field display name, {1} for the localized word 'unknown', {2} for the field internal name, {3} for { and {4} for }.

data.name: LicNoSiteIfFarm
data.value: The license store already contains a valid farm-wide license that covers all site collections in this SharePoint server farm. Individual site-collection licenses will not be accepted into the license store as long as the entire server farm is already fully licensed.

data.name: ConfigHelp_ItemLocaleChoice
data.value:
The drop-down menu provides all standard-defined regions. You can also choose from the following "dynamic" cultures:

  • Server-side 'current' locale — the culture currently set to use by default for the Windows and/or ASP.NET installation on the server
  • Web site locale — the culture selected under Site Settings / Regional Settings
  • User account locale — the culture selected for the current end user account unter My Settings / Regional Settings
  • Server-side installation locale — the culture of the Windows installation on the server
  • User agent (browser) locale — the browser-supplied 'preferred culture' hint

The default choice is: Server-side 'current' locale.

data.name: LicStudio
data.value: Open the {0} Studio to manage your free or commercial license(s).

data.name: NoServerContext
data.value: A SharePoint Server Context object could not be acquired. This usually means that no default Shared Service Provider has been set up in Central Administration for storing and managing User Profiles.

data.name: CfgSettingTitle_FilterTabReverse
data.value: Always reverse the sort order of quick-filter tabs

data.name: PD_DataSources_cc_c
data.value: reading from a (possibly outdated) in-memory copy of the COMPLETE set of backend data

data.name: PD_DataSources_cc_n
data.value: every rendering request will connect to the backing store of this Data Source

data.name: PD_DataSources_desc
data.value: Optionally specify a description for this Data Source.

data.name: PD_DataSources_du_c
data.value: Unless you specify a static set of data records below, this data source always returns the specified number of semi-randomly generated "dummy" records for testing purposes. (For an ever-changing random number of records, specify a number lower than or equal to 1.)

data.name: PD_DataSources_du_f
data.value: Specify the names of the fields that each record in the data set of this data source should contain (one field per line).

data.name: PD_DataSources_du_r
data.value:
Unless you specify a static set of data records here, this data source always returns the above-specified number of semi-randomly generated "dummy" records for testing purposes. To pre-define your data set here instead, use JSON syntax -- always specify an [array], even if there is only 1 record -- ie. for 3 static pre-defined records:

[ { "YourField1": "ID 1", "YourField2": "Title 1" }, { "YourField1": "ID 2", "YourField2": "Title 2" }, { "YourField1": "ID 3", "YourField2": "Title 3" } ]
Do not attempt to introduce additional fields here that you have not defined above under Data fields — only defined fields will be shown in Data Source consumers.

data.name: PD_DataSources_ua_g
data.value: Select which user group collection to enumerate, if any.

data.name: PD_DataSources_ua_u
data.value: Select which user account collection to enumerate, if any.

data.value: SharePoint artifacts (Features, List Templates, Column Types, Content Types, Web Part Templates...)

data.value: Descriptor for a set of SharePoint Lists and Views

data.name: LicUsers1

data.value: Some features are only available to Site Collection administrators or farm administrators.

data.name: Tool_Localizer_Select
data.value: Select a language to translate into:

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_NoDefaultInst
data.value: Configurables are lists of items for defining and customizing the behaviors of this software (such as Export Actions in ExportZen, Data Sources and Data Field Templates in PeopleZen, Print Views and Print Launchers in PrintZen, Upload Actions in UploadZen). By default, each Site Collection has its own non-removable default instance that can be customized and to which additional instances can be added. In extensive farm setups (1000s of Site Collections), these default instances may be a hindrance and using only custom farm-level instances may be preferable. Tick this option to never provide the default instance on the Site Collection level.

data.name: PD_AuthenticationTypes_Encryption
data.value: a cryptographic signature that identifies the sender

data.name: Tool_ItemEditor_DelPrompt
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this {0}? This cannot be undone.

data.name: NotEnabled
data.value: {1} has been successfully installed. Now, before you can start using it, a farm administrator needs to explicitly "enable" it just once.

data.name: CfgHelp
data.value: To learn more about a configuration setting, simply select its row.

data.name: CfgInfo
data.value: The following farm-wide settings apply to all web applications and site collections throughout this server farm, unless overridden at the site collection level:

data.name: LicTargetIDs
data.value: These IDs are for the {0} Site Collection. If you need to send us IDs for a different Site Collection, select it at the top. (For farm-wide licensing, ignore this note.)

data.name: LicTrialHtml_White
data.value:
On {0}, your current evaluation license will expire.

Learn about our licensing offerings (online)

data.name: Old_NoFilterZen
data.value: {PROD} (Basic edition) only supports incoming Web Part Connections from FilterZen (Basic edition) Filter Web Parts (and only via the Connection Type 'Send values as filters to'). Disconnect from the current provider Web Part.

data.value: Would you like to go there now?

data.name: ListItemValueRequired
data.value: Please specify a value for this required Column.

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_LinkTarget
data.value: Data record "Name/Title" links produced by the {PROD} Web Part can target an HTML window of your choice. Use _self for these links to open in the current browser window, _blank for them to open in a new window, _modal for them to open in a modal pop-up dialog window, _popup for a SharePoint 2010 "modal" in-page popup, or the name of an IFRAME or FRAME element residing in your Web Part Page.

data.name: ConfigHelp_ItemEncodingChoice
data.value: The drop-down menu provides all standard-defined text encodings. The default choice is: Server-side default encoding, meaning the default encoding defined for the Windows and/or ASP.NET installation on the server.

data.name: Tool_Transfer_Export4

data.name: PD_SearchScope_OneLevel
data.value: Searches the immediate child objects of the base object, excluding the base object.

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_VcardPropFormat
data.value: The HTML to be generated by the {PROD} Web Part for vCard export links. Valid placeholders: {0} for the vCard export URL, {1} for { and {2} for }.

data.name: Tool_Localizer_InfoHint
data.value: Translating every single resource might be overkill for your project requirements. With a separate browser tab open, you can locate in the {0} user interfaces the text fragments you really need to translate, then use your browser's Page Search feature to find those somewhere below:

data.name: Tool_ItemEditor_NewDesc
data.value: This new {0} has not yet been saved. Before saving it, also change this description to avoid confusion later on.

data.name: Tool_ItemEditor_ListSet_ExceptTemplateType
data.value: ...or Lists of the following template type:

data.name: Tool_SiteUsers_Desc
data.value: If you licensed this software based on user numbers, use this tool to view all Site Collection accounts (including individuals, service accounts, admins) that are counted.

data.name: Tool_SiteUsers_Info
data.value:
Total number of user accounts licensed / to be licensed: {0}
This is for the {1} Site Collection only. Cross-check all Site Collections ultimately using this software for conclusive licensing findings. You can select other Web Applications and Site Collections from the drop-downs at the top of this page.

If you want to remove a user account, it is not sufficient to just "un-permission" the user at the Website level; to fully delete the account from the Site Collection, simply click through to its info page from its link below.

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_AjaxFirst
data.value: Unless disabled below, all interactive end user re-adjustments of information shown in a {PROD} Web Part refresh its display asynchronously (without reloading the page) via AJAX; however, when the page is first rendered, the initial display of the {PROD} Web Part is by default already loaded and pre-populated at render time. Unless this significantly (!) slows down the rendering time of the entire page, this is the preferable and more end user-friendly approach. Tick this check box to never load and show data records at render time and instead lazy-load them via AJAX once the full page is ready and fully loaded client-side.

data.name: ConfigHelp_ItemListSet
data.value:
To define the set of Lists, first select either Show in all Lists or Show in no Lists, then click the except... link to describe which Lists to exclude from that selection. You can exclude:

  • Lists of the selected base types
  • Lists of the selected template types
  • Lists of the selected base templates
  • or Lists with the specified names or IDs.

To define the set of Views, first select either Show in all Views or Show in no Views, then click the except... link to describe which Views to exclude from that selection. You can exclude:

  • the default View
  • hidden Views
  • personal Views
  • or Views with the specified names or IDs.

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_AltEnum
data.value: Experimental option (MOSS 2007 only) -- do not tick unless so instructed by ROXORITY technical support.

data.name: CfgSettingTitle_AjaxFirst
data.value: AJAX-based lazy loading of data records after page render (typically not preferable)

data.name: NoLiteConfig
data.value: This product configuration setting is not available in the Lite edition.

data.name: PD_AuthenticationTypes_Secure
data.value: requests secure authentication using NTLM or Kerberos

data.name: ConfigHelp_Intro
data.value:
The following configuration settings are available to administrative users on the Configuration page in your {0} Studio, which you can access via Site Settings / {0} Studio / Configuration Settings.

Each setting has a global value scoped to the SharePoint server farm, and this value can optionally be overridden on the Site Collection level. The following settings are available:

data.name: PD_ItemEditor_name
data.value: This name will typically not be visible on content pages to end users, but helps you stay organized.

data.name: PD_ItemEditor_webs
data.value: Optionally select in which web sites this {0} will be available. By default, it will be available in all web sites and this usually does not need to be changed during your first explorations within this software. Only perform changes if you are familiar with the terminology presented in the above property editor. Should your changes not result in the expected outcome, you can always easily set this back to "all web sites, no exceptions" and then resume experimenting incrementally with your exceptions.

data.name: CfgSettingTitle_SkipUnknownProps
data.value: Exclude all record fields without values (in Tiles view)

data.name: CfgSettingTitle_DoNormalize
data.value: Normalize international characters in quick-filter tabs

data.name: LicEvalExpired
data.value: The Ultimate edition license originally installed reverted to the free Lite edition on {0}. You can keep it if this suffices — otherwise, request an extension or compare the editions and explore your free and commercial licensing options (online).

data.name: LicEvalExpires
data.value: This temporary Ultimate edition license will convert to the free Lite edition on {0}. You can then choose to keep it that way if this suffices, request an extension or compare the editions and explore your free and commercial licensing options (online).

data.name: NopeTrial
data.value: The capability "{0}" is only available with a fully validated product license.

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_SspName
data.value: We recommend to leave this blank in order to use the runtime-default Shared Service Provider.

data.name: HomeInfo
data.value: Use the following resources to get started with {0}:

data.name: D_Prop5
data.value: Basic filtering options below — for additional filtering, connect this Web Part to a Filter Web Part.

data.name: D_Prop4
data.value: Specify the maximum number of records per page, or 0 to disable paging and display all records at once.

data.name: GroupInteractiveDir
data.value: Allow interactive ad-hoc change of grouping direction (ascending / descending)

data.name: WssInfoAttached
data.value: This Content Type is currently attached to the following {0} Lists:

data.name: FarmAdminErrorNoServer
data.value: This problem typically occurs mostly in fresh SharePoint setups on non-server operating systems (such as using Vista or Windows 7 instead of Windows 2003 or 2008 Server for hosting SharePoint), or in heavily re-configured environments.

data.name: CfgSettingTitle_Compare
data.value: Local text comparison mode for certain Data Source connection providers

data.name: LicExpiryHtml
data.value:
Thank you for using ROXORITY software! You are free to continue your usage, but as it's been {0} days now, we'd just like to ask you to install a valid free or commercial license file.

If you already have a license file, scroll down a bit — otherwise, you can:
  • get your freeware Lite edition license file (no site, user or time limits; no strings attached),
  • order a commercial Basic or Ultimate edition license,
  • or request a free extension license to continue your Ultimate edition evaluation.

data.name: ConfigHelp_ItemTypeChoice
data.value: Drop-down menu to pick from a set of choices

data.name: LicExpiryHtml_White
data.value:
Thank you for evaluating this software product! It's been {0} days now, and we'd just like to ask you to install a valid license file.

If you already have a license file, scroll down a bit — otherwise, you can:
  • review our commercial licensing offers or place an order online,
  • or request an extension license to continue your software evaluation.

data.name: ConfigHelp_ItemWebSet
data.value:
To define the set of Web Sites, first select either Available in all Web Sites or Available in no Web Sites, then click the except... link to describe which web sites to exclude from that selection. You can exclude:
  • the root Web Site (of the respectively-current Site Collection)

data.name: PD_DataSources_mf
data.value: Typically your Data Source connection provider is able to determine all Data Fields known to the Data Source (see the above Data Field selection drop-downs to see this in action). With some Data Sources; however, not all fields that in fact exist at the Data Source backing store are retrieved. Specify those here (using the internal field name rather than display name, title, caption etc.), one per line.

data.name: PD_DataSources_cl
data.value: This clears the cache (on the receiving WFE server only) for this Data Source to reflect recent changes in the backend data or your Data Field Templates immediately.

data.name: PD_DataSources_cn
data.value: Refreshes the data records currently being displayed (just before displaying them BUT *after* filtering / grouping / sorting!), whenever they are fetched from an end user. This may incur a significant performance penalty with a high paging size.

data.name: PD_DataSources_cc
data.value:
If caching is enabled, {PROD} always creates a full cache of all data records in memory the first time a rendering request consuming this Data Source is served after a web front-end server has been reset.

Caution: enabling caching will sometimes show stale data. Changes to records in your Data Source will not be reflected in real-time but delayed (see Cache Refresh Rate below when caching is enabled). Completely new records added after the cache was last built up will go completely unnoticed until the next server reset unless you tick the Periodically rebuild cache fully check-box option, visible below when caching is enabled.

If this is a Database Data Source and you just enabled Caching for it, you need to review the instructions for the ADO.NET data query setting on the Database tab (and its current value!) carefully to ensure a consistent result set sort order is at all times guaranteed by your query.

data.name: PD_DataSources_cr
data.value:
After a web front-end server has been reset, {PROD} always creates a full cache of all records in memory the first time a rendering request consuming this Data Source is served.

Afterwards, {PROD} resynchronizes only a certain number of cached records during each request to adequately balance performance with accuracy of the information displayed.

Specify the number of records to refresh during each {PROD} rendering request. A higher number (40 or more) reflects recent data changes much sooner but slows down {PROD} rendering significantly, and vice versa a lower number reflects recent data changes much later at a substantially better rendering performance.

Specify 0 to never refresh cached data records during rendering. If you don't specify a valid integer number greater than or equal to 0, the default value of 10 will be used.

data.name: PD_DataSources_ed
data.value: User names are usually displayed based on your Name/Title data field/s setting (on the Data Fields tab). Some of the users returned by this Data Source may not have a preferred name (such as first and last name combined) set and might show a fully-qualified domain account name (ie. companydomain\user123). Tick this option to always suppress the domain part of the user name when displayed in the Name/Title special field.

data.name: PD_DataSources_ex
data.value:
You can optionally specify the patterns of user names (one per line) that should always be excluded from all {PROD} Web Parts (for example, service accounts). You may include an asterisk (*) only at the beginning ("ends with"), at the end ("begins with") or both ("contains"). This setting is not case-sensitive.

Important: the patterns in this setting are matched against the field denoted as the Logon name data field (on the Data Fields tab).

data.name: PD_DataSources_vc
data.value:
Advanced users only! When customizing, seek assistance in our software support forums.

Contains the full template for the entire vCard 3.0 export of a user profile (excluding the BEGIN, VERSION, REV and END lines). Placeholders in [square brackets] denote Data Source field names and will be replaced with their respective field values at export time.

In your [square bracket placeholders], you can specify any data field name supported by this Data Source as well as any of the following Special Field names:

[rox___pt] — Name/Title data field/s specified above
[rox___pp] — Picture data field/s specified above
[rox___pu] — Link URL data field/s specified above
[rox___pm] — Presence email address data field/s specified above
[rox___pl] — Logon name data field/s specified above

data.name: PD_DataSources_rc
data.value:
Typically neither required nor recommended for production systems, except when "many" (>1x a day) data record additions or deletions are expected at the backing store of this Data Source.

After a web front-end server has been reset, {PROD} always creates a full cache of all records in memory the first time a rendering request consuming this Data Source is served.

Those cached records are periodically refreshed at the rate specified above; however, completely new data records go unnoticed until the next server reset.

Tick this check box for {PROD} to completely rebuild the cache periodically every nth {PROD} rendering request, which as a consequence may significantly slow down every nth request but captures new records added since the cache was last re-created (n = number of user profiles divided by the cache request rate specified above).

data.name: PD_DataSources_su
data.value: Specify a fully-qualified Windows logon name (in the yourdomain\user123 format) for impersonation.

data.name: PD_DataSources_sp
data.value: The password will be stored encrypted.

data.name: PD_DataSources_s2
data.value: Primary sorting is defined per Web Part (or other Data Source consumer) and may or may not be set interactively by end users depending on said configuration. When a sort is applied, however, this setting lets you specify a secondary sort-by field (use the internal Data Field name instead of its human-readable or localized caption or title). Secondary sorting defaults to ascending, prefix with a - (minus) character for descending. This setting is ignored for Web Parts (or other Data Source consumers) that enforce a randomized sort order.

data.name: PD_DataSources_p*
data.value:
This lets you define a special "{0}" field, which can then be linked or displayed in a specific manner if so configured at the data source consumer side (ie. {PROD} Web Part, Lookup Filter, Lookup Column etc.) The source data fields specified here will be probed in the specified order to populate this target special field.

Each line contains the source field name to probe enclosed by [square brackets]. You can also combine other static textual content with one or multiple [field names] in each line. For each record, only the first line to return a non-empty value will be used and all other lines will be ignored.

data.name: PD_DataSources_pu
data.value: URL for linking Name/Title and/or picture

data.name: PD_DataSources_pl
data.value: full user logon name / domain account name (domainname\username)

data.name: PD_DataSources_pd
data.value:
*Specify the fields to be shown by default in the Data Source Preview and in newly created, not yet customized consumers of this Data Source (ie. {PROD} Web Parts, Lookup Filters, Lookup Columns etc.)

Each line contains an internal field name. Fields will then be displayed by Data Source consumers in the same order. Note that this is a default template that can be customized for each consumer.

To override the display name of a field in the Data Source consumer, enter your own display name in the same line next to the internal name, separated by a colon [:].

You can only include original fields provided by this Data Source (as listed in the above drop-down) — any special fields defined below cannot be included here (but the Data Source consumer itself will know how to utilize those depending on its configuration).

data.name: ConfigHelp_ReplNew
data.value: On the Configuration page in the {0} Studio, tick this check box

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_EmbedFilters
data.value: By default, the Interactive Filters container area of a FilterZen Web Part will be visually embedded inside the {PROD} Web Part it is connected to (if Ajax-based Live Filtering has been enabled for the latter). This usually results in a preferable user experience, but this setting allows you to turn the behaviour off, should you want to.

data.name: Tool_ItemEditor_Disabled

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_NoAjax
data.value: Certain end-user interactions (such as paging forwards or back, re-sorting, re-grouping or re-filtering) are handled by {PROD} using AJAX, without reloading the entire page. This highly preferable behavior however can break in certain very rare FBA / ISA constellations or other kinds of highly customized enterprise VPN / proxy setups. Tick this check box to disable all AJAX-based interactions and revert to a page-reloading, post-back style of handling user interaction.

data.name: PD_DataSources_t
data.value: Select which type of data connection will be used by this data source. If you change this, all settings in the other tabs need to be reviewed and many will have to be re-configured.

data.name: PD_DataSources_s

data.name: PD_DataSources_p
data.value:
Click the Refresh button above to load a dynamic preview of this Data Source with its current settings (even if not yet saved). You can parameterize the preview with the various options offered above. It only shows the fields specified in your Default data fields setting (on the Data Fields tab).

Important note: this is a data preview rather than a design preview. Depending on loaded out-of-box or custom style sheets, the look and feel of your ultimate Data Source consumers in your content sites will vary from the visual design presented above.

data.name: LicNoUpload

If you are certain that the license file has not been modified, then it was probably issued for a different server farm or site collection than the current one, for a different product, or for a maximum number of users that is exceeded in this site collection.

No changes were written to the license store.

data.name: PD_DataSources_db_pw
data.value: If you used the {$ROXPWD$} placeholder in the setting above, you can specify the password here. This will be stored encrypted.

data.name: PD_DataSources_db_sq
data.value:
Specify, in SQL (or any other query language dialect supported by the selected ADO.NET database connection provider), the query sent to the database to fetch the result set of records to be returned by this Data Source.

Important: if you have Caching enabled (on the Caching tab) for this ADO.NET Data Source, you need to ensure consistent sort order of the raw result set at all times by including an ORDER BY clause or equivalent.

data.name: PD_DataSources_db_ac
data.value: Select the ADO.NET database connection provider to use for this Data Source. If required, you can restrict or extend the available choices with the ADO.NET Database Connection Providers for SQL Data Access configuration setting.

data.name: PD_DataSources_db_cs
data.value: Specify the ADO.NET connection string (including user credentials if applicable) used by this Data Source to connect to the database. If you want to specify a password but hide it (and store it encrypted), enter the placeholder {$ROXPWD$} in place of the password and then specify the password in the field below instead.

data.name: PD_DataSources_ds_au
data.value: Select how this Data Source should authenticate itself to the directory service specified above.

data.name: PD_DataSources_ds_cs
data.value: An LDAP/ADSI connection string that is used by this Data Source to connect to your directory service.

data.name: PD_DataSources_ds_us
data.value: If you selected Secure under the Authentication mode setting above, you can optionally specify a fully-qualified user name for authentication. If you leave this blank, the Secure authentication mode will use the current security context; otherwise, you also need to specify a password below.

data.name: PD_DataSources_ds_pw
data.value: If you selected Secure under the Authentication mode setting above, you can optionally specify a password for authentication of the above user name. If you leave this blank, the Secure authentication mode will use the current security context; otherwise, you also need to specify a user name above.

data.name: PD_DataSources_ds_sq
data.value: An optional LDAP/ADSI query that is used by the directory service to pre-filter the result set send back to this Data Dource. (With a filter query defined here, this Data Source performs a directory service Search operation and yields the result set returned; without, it simply enumerates through all directory entries.)

data.name: PD_DataSources_ds_ss
data.value: Select the search scope to observe when invoking the directory search specified by the above LDAP search query.

data.name: Tool_Transfer_SiteSchema
data.value: Custom-defined elements for this Site Collection:

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_FilterTabThreshold
data.value:
By default, quick-filter tabs are generated so that all tabs correspond to existing data field values. This is preferable for multi-choice properties (such as for example Skills, Responsibilities etc. for Farm User Profiles) but less usable for potentially vast numbers of values (First Name, Last Name...) — therefore, beyond a certain number of values quick-filter tabs will be reduced to alphabetic or numeric indices (A, B, C...)

Use this setting to specify that threshold. If you don't specify a valid integer number between 2 and 50, the default value of 16 will be used.

data.name: CfgSettingTitle_KnownPropFormat
data.value: HTML template for record field with value

data.name: NoServerContextStatus
data.value: The User Profiles shared service application is currently unavailable: please try again later. (Status: {0})

data.name: PreFilterHint
data.value: Check here whether your currently selected Data Source supports configurable pre-filtering

data.name: Tool_Transfer_Desc
data.value: Use this tool to import or export select configuration settings or user interface localizations.

data.name: NoLiteConfig_White
data.value: This product configuration setting requires a valid software license.

data.name: JqueryNone
data.value:
jQuery is not being embedded — more...
You have decided to not have this {PROD} Web Part load the jQuery library into this page. This will break the {PROD} Web Part unless jQuery v1.8.1 or higher is being included by some other Web Part or by your page design. If {PROD} stopped working after you changed your page design or removed some other Web Part, re-include jQuery from the Web Part settings or via the Product Configuration.

data.name: CfgSettingDesc__nojquery
data.value: Some {0} end user-facing artifacts require (and load into the respective host pages) the jQuery library, version 1.8.1. Embedding jQuery more than once in a single page can cause JavaScript warnings in Internet Explorer with some few jQuery plugins (and only if any are used in your farm at all). Tick this check box only if your master pages, web pages or third-party extensions also already include jQuery globally (not just on some individual pages) and independently of {0} to prevent {0} from loading jQuery too. If you do so, you need to make sure jQuery v1.8.1 or higher is loaded on each page hosting also hosting {0} user interface artifacts, or {0} will appear broken. This is a global default setting that can be optionally overridden locally where applicable.
